Page 2, PRESIDENT'S COLUMN*
Sincere efforts were made to construct such a document. But It
couldn't be done! The more we slaved over words and became
Immersed In specifics, the more It became evident that attempts to
achieve such a legalistic document were futile - and probably
unwlse.
The position of the Executive Committee was presented to the Board
at Columbus, by the Chairman of the TV Board, Loren Stone. I have
asked him to let me Include this statement in my column./it was the
consensus of the Board that the position stated above govern oifr*
general n toward NETRC and that the cooperative working
relationships einrio be worked out on a day-to-day, cajje-by-c^re
basis by the officers of the two agencies.
